text: hello and welcome to an introductory
video about Amazon pinpoint my name is
Pablo siono catidis and I'm a specially
solution architect focusing on Amazon
pinpoint and Amazon simple email service
Amazon pinpoint is a flexible scalable
marketing Communication Service that
connects you with customers over six
different channels including email SMS
and voice
in today's video you will learn four of
the common use cases pinpoint can add
value to its key capabilities and how to
get started
let's start with Amazon pinpoints four
common use cases
the first one is the consolidation of
customer Communications under one
platform
some businesses might have one vendor
per Communication channel which
increases technical complexity and
fragments the customer engagement data
with Amazon pinpoint you have one user
interface and one set of API operations
to send messages schedule Communications
manage resources and analyze customers
engagement data this reduces both
Technical and Commercial complexity
another use case is sending messages
reliably and at scale this becomes key
especially for use cases such as
one-time password sensitive documents
payment confirmations and appointment
reminders
Amazon pinpoint's email Channel supports
both shared and dedicated IPS allowing
you to reach throughput of thousands of
emails per second while pinpoint's SMS
Channel supports more than 240 countries
and territories
the third use case is targeting the
right customer with the right message
with Amazon pinpoint you can import your
customer data and based on your
customers characteristics create Dynamic
segments for example select all
customers who are living in London
United Kingdom
additionally Amazon pinpoint integrates
with Amazon personalized which is a
fully managed machine learning service
that uses your data to generate product
recommendations
these product recommendations can be
added in real time to your SMS email and
post notification messages
with the use of Amazon sagemaker aws's
machine learning platform you can
leverage predictive models to create
segments a good example is predicting
which customers will turn and
accordingly engage with them via channel
of their preference
Amazon pinpoint can also be used as a
back-end resource that adds
communication capabilities to your
application imagine that you own a human
resource management application and you
would like to add email campaign
capabilities so that your customers can
email their employees regarding company
updates in that case you can utilize
Amazon pinpoints apis to import employee
data create segments and send messages
now let's have a look at Amazon
pinpoint's key components and how they
interact with each other in a logical
flow
starting from left to right Amazon
pinpoint accepts two types of data sets
the first one is customer data including
Channel addresses such as email address
mobile number push notification token as
well as customer characteristics such as
the first name or channel of preference
these data points are used to create
customer segments or to personalize the
message itself for example an SMS could
start hello brackets first name and that
will be populated with the customer data
imported to Amazon pinpoint
the second type of data set are events
that your customers generate on your
mobile or web application
this event can be used for either
behavioral analytics for example how
many unique pages did the customer visit
yesterday but they can also serve as
triggers for communications for example
upon successful registration send a
welcome email Amazon pinpoint supports
both transactional and promotional
messages
for transactional messages Amazon
pinpoint can integrate with your
application using its rest API or its
SDK which is available in 11 programming
languages note that if your use case
includes only transactional messages you
don't need to import your customer data
instead you can call Amazon pinpoints
API and specify the address you want to
send the message to for example send the
purchase confirmation from sales
amazon.com to Pablos amazon.com
for marketing use cases you can import
your customer data into Amazon pinpoint
and start building segments that you can
engage via campaigns or Journeys a
customer segment is defined as a group
of customers who share the same
attribute value
an Amazon pinpoint campaign is a single
step customer engagement where you get
to select a channel a segment a message
template and when to send it campaigns
can be used for ad hook messages such as
promotions product drops as well as
recurring Communications such as
newsletters on the other hand an Amazon
pinpoint journey is a multi-step
customer engagement where you get to use
more than one channel at a time as well
as incorporate conditional logic to your
Communications for example you can send
an email check if the recipient has
opened it after one hour and if they
haven't then send them an SMS
with Amazon pinpoint you can reach your
customers via six different channels
these are email SMS push notifications
voice which also integrates with aws's
Cloud contact center called Amazon
connect in-app messages and custom
Channel Amazon pinpoint's custom Channel
allows you to integrate with third
parties via their API a good example is
WhatsApp
regarding analytics Amazon pinpoint
captures customer engagement events such
as email links clicked email sent and
SMS delivered
these events are used to monitor your
campaigns Journeys and transactional
messages performance via their
respective dashboards Amazon pinpoint
integrates with Amazon Kinesis data fire
hose which is an extract transform and
load service allowing you to stream all
Amazon pinpoint events to a variety of
other AWS services including databases
such as Amazon redshift this enables you
to use an existing business intelligence
tool like Amazon quicksite for better
data analysis and visualization
note that customer engagement data
displayed on Amazon pinpoint console
have a 90 days retention period thus
it's recommended to enable data
streaming using Amazon Kinesis data fire
host Amazon pinpoint can be operated by
non-technical users by the AWS console
it provides an intuitive user interface
for segments message templates campaigns
and Journeys creation as well as
dashboards for performance monitoring
developers on the other hand can benefit
from Amazon pinpoints API operations for
sending transactional messages through
their application code as well as
developing marketing automations
Amazon pinpoint pricing gives you the
flexibility to experiment with different
channels as you only pay for the
messages you send
to get started visit Amazon pinpoints
self-paced online Workshop by following
the link below this Workshop covers
basic areas starting from customer data
import segment creation campaign
scheduling all the way to machine
learning product recommendations and
common API operations examples
along with the workshop it is
recommended to visit Amazon pinpoint
resources page where you can find the
user guide developer guide and API
reference documentation
thank you for watching this video visit
aws.amazon.com forward slash pinpoint to
find more information
